channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Israel says it has recovered the last remaining body of a hostage held in Gaza
item.description: The recovery is a major breakthrough in moving a three-month ceasefire in Gaza into its next phase.
item.content:encoded: The recovery is a major breakthrough in moving a three-month ceasefire in Gaza into its next phase.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Ukrainians are sharing hacks online on how to survive winter power cuts
item.description: After repeated Russian attacks on Ukraine's energy grid, Ukrainians face long outages during a cold winter at war. On social media, Ukrainians share tips for keeping warm at home.
item.content:encoded:
After repeated Russian attacks on Ukraine's energy grid, Ukrainians face long outages during a cold winter at war. On social media, Ukrainians share tips for keeping warm at home.

(Image credit: Andrew Kravchenko)
item.dc:creator: Hanna Palamarenko

item.title: Israel finds the last hostage body in Gaza, paving the way for next steps in Trump plan
item.description: The Israeli military says the body of Ran Gvili, a 24-year-old special forces policeman killed while fighting Hamas militants on Oct. 7, 2023, has been found.
item.content:encoded:
The Israeli military says the body of Ran Gvili, a 24-year-old special forces policeman killed while fighting Hamas militants on Oct. 7, 2023, has been found.

(Image credit: Ilia Yefimovich)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: France could become second country to ban social media for some teens
item.description: France is set to debate a proposed social media ban for those under 15 years old, as the country's president backs stricter rules and a high school phone ban.
item.content:encoded: France is set to debate a proposed social media ban for those under 15 years old, as the country's president backs stricter rules and a high school phone ban.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: China's top generals under investigation as country's leader clears out ranks
item.description: China announced two of its top generals are under investigation, including the country's most senior general. Analysts suspect it's a political purge by Chinese leader Xi Jinping.
item.content:encoded: China announced two of its top generals are under investigation, including the country's most senior general. Analysts suspect it's a political purge by Chinese leader Xi Jinping.
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Israel launches 'large-scale operation' to locate last hostage in Gaza
item.description: The return of the remaining hostage, Ran Gvili, has been widely seen as removing the remaining obstacle to proceeding with the U.S.-brokered ceasefire's second phase.
item.content:encoded:
The return of the remaining hostage, Ran Gvili, has been widely seen as removing the remaining obstacle to proceeding with the U.S.-brokered ceasefire's second phase.

(Image credit: Leo Correa)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Where is the threat from Russia and China in the Arctic?
item.description: As Trump points to Russia and China near Greenland, experts say the biggest Russian and Chinese activity is elsewhere in the Arctic.
item.content:encoded: As Trump points to Russia and China near Greenland, experts say the biggest Russian and Chinese activity is elsewhere in the Arctic.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: U.S. rock climber Alex Honnold reaches top of Taipei 101 skyscraper without ropes
item.description: Cheers erupted from a street-level crowd as Alex Honnold reached the top of the spire of the 508-meter (1,667-foot) tower, about 90 minutes after he started.
item.content:encoded:
Cheers erupted from a street-level crowd as Alex Honnold reached the top of the spire of the 508-meter (1,667-foot) tower, about 90 minutes after he started.

(Image credit: Chiang Ying-ying)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Russian strikes knock out heat in freezing Kyiv as peace talks continue
item.description: Russian strikes left much of Kyiv without heat, water and power during freezing temperature, even as Ukraine, Russia and the U.S. held talks on ending the nearly four-year war.
item.content:encoded:
Russian strikes left much of Kyiv without heat, water and power during freezing temperature, even as Ukraine, Russia and the U.S. held talks on ending the nearly four-year war.

(Image credit: Danylo Antoniuk)
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Greenland, tariffs and NATO: a rollercoaster week in transatlantic relations
item.description: After President Trump's upheaval at Davos, U.S. allies are openly questioning whether Washington can still anchor the rules-based order.
item.content:encoded: After President Trump's upheaval at Davos, U.S. allies are openly questioning whether Washington can still anchor the rules-based order.
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx
